p: In this study, we showed that EV71 RNA contains m 6A modifications that play a critical role in viral replication. Knockdown of m 6A methyltransferases, demethylases, and binding proteins in host cells affected viral replication. In addition, mutation of the m 6A modification sites in the infectious clone decreased EV71 progeny virus production and protein expression, which is similar to the effect of METTL3 knockdown. Notably, we found that METTL3 interacted with viral RdRp 3D protein and regulated its modification to modulate viral replication. Thus, our findings demonstrated that m 6A modification represents an important component in the regulation of EV71 replication.
